pageContext.claim: “Look at what just happened in Virginia, where they sent in 500,000 applications.And they're -- most of them are to wrong people. They sent some to dogs. They sent two to cats. They sent people that are -- that passed away, dead people. They were sent to dead people, and 500,000 applications. This is crazy, what we are doing. And it's not a question of anything else. It can't work. It hasn't worked in little districts.”
pageContext.analysis: The Center For Voter Information did send 500,000 applications for ballots out to Fairfax County voters in Virginia. There’s no indication that they went to dogs or dead people. Rather, they included an incorrect return address information. The county registration did not believe the action was malicious — just sloppy.
